requirement_summary: Principles relating to processing of personal data
description: Policy documenting adherence to data processing principles for law enforcement purposes: lawfulness, fairness, purpose limitation, data minimisation, accuracy, storage limitation, integrity and confidentiality, and accountability, including clear distinction between categories of data subjects (suspects, convicted, victims, witnesses)
auditor_questions: Show me your data processing policy covering all principles in Article 4 for law enforcement data
How do you distinguish between different categories of data subjects as required by Article 6?
How do you ensure data is kept accurate and up to date, and correct inaccurate data without delay?
How do you enforce purpose limitation when personal data is processed for prevention, investigation, or detection of criminal offences?

maturity_levels.basic: Data processing policy exists covering all Article 4 principles
maturity_levels.intermediate: Data subject categories clearly documented, accuracy verification procedures, purpose limitation controls enforced
maturity_levels.advanced: Automated data quality management, real-time purpose limitation enforcement, continuous compliance monitoring against all principles

description: Documentation of the legal basis for each processing activity, demonstrating that processing is necessary for the performance of a task carried out by a competent authority for law enforcement purposes, and is based on Union or Member State law
auditor_questions: Show me the legal basis for each law enforcement data processing activity
How do you determine that processing is necessary for the performance of a task by a competent authority?
What Member State or Union law provides the basis for this processing activity?
How do you document and review the lawfulness of processing operations over time?

maturity_levels.basic: Legal basis documented for each processing activity
maturity_levels.intermediate: Legal basis register maintained, necessity assessments documented, regular legal reviews conducted
maturity_levels.advanced: Automated legal basis validation, dynamic necessity assessments, integrated with processing activity register

description: Records of categories of processing activities maintained by the controller, including contact details, processing purposes, categories of recipients, transfers to third countries, time limits for erasure, and general description of technical and organisational security measures
auditor_questions: Show me the record of processing activities maintained under Article 24
Does the record include all required elements: purposes, categories of recipients, transfers, erasure timelines?
How frequently is the record reviewed and updated?
Show me the general description of technical and organisational security measures included in the record

maturity_levels.basic: Record of processing activities exists with all required elements
maturity_levels.intermediate: Regular reviews and updates, linked to data protection impact assessments, processor records aligned
maturity_levels.advanced: Automated record management system, real-time updates from processing systems, integrated compliance dashboard

description: Logs of automated processing operations including collection, alteration, consultation, disclosure (including transfers), combination and erasure, with justification, date and time, identification of persons who consulted or disclosed data, and identity of recipients
retention_period: Minimum as specified by Member State law, typically 3-5 years
auditor_questions: Show me the processing logs for collection, alteration, consultation, disclosure, combination, and erasure operations
For this consultation, can you demonstrate the justification, date, time, and identity of the person who accessed the data?
How do you ensure logs are used solely for lawfulness verification, self-monitoring, integrity, security, and criminal proceedings?
Show me how logs are made available to the supervisory authority on request

maturity_levels.basic: Logs maintained for all required processing operations with basic identification
maturity_levels.intermediate: Comprehensive logging with full justification, automated log integrity protection, regular self-monitoring reviews
maturity_levels.advanced: Real-time automated log analysis, tamper-proof audit trail, anomaly detection for unauthorised access patterns

requirement_summary: Data protection by design and by default
description: Documentation demonstrating that appropriate technical and organisational measures are implemented at the time of determination of means of processing and at the time of processing itself, ensuring data protection principles are effectively implemented and processing is limited to what is necessary
auditor_questions: Show me how data protection by design was considered when determining the means of processing
What technical measures ensure that by default only necessary personal data is processed?
How do you limit the amount of personal data collected, extent of processing, storage period, and accessibility?
Show me evidence that data protection by design principles are embedded in system procurement and development

maturity_levels.basic: Data protection by design considerations documented for each processing system
maturity_levels.intermediate: DPbD assessment integrated into system development lifecycle, default settings minimise data processing, regular reviews
maturity_levels.advanced: Automated privacy engineering tools, continuous DPbD validation, privacy-enhancing technologies deployed by default

description: Documentation of technical and organisational measures ensuring appropriate security for law enforcement data processing, covering the ten control areas in Article 29(2): equipment access control, data media control, storage control, user control, data access control, communication control, input control, transport control, recovery, and reliability/integrity
auditor_questions: Show me how you implement each of the ten security controls listed in Article 29(2)
How do you prevent unauthorised persons from accessing processing equipment and data media?
How do you ensure that it is possible to verify which personal data have been input, when, and by whom?
Show me your recovery capabilities and how you ensure system reliability and data integrity

maturity_levels.basic: All ten control areas documented with basic implementation measures
maturity_levels.intermediate: Comprehensive controls with regular testing, automated access management, encrypted transport, documented recovery procedures
maturity_levels.advanced: Continuous security monitoring across all control areas, automated compliance testing, zero-trust architecture, real-time integrity verification

description: Data protection impact assessment for processing operations likely to result in high risk to the rights and freedoms of natural persons, containing a systematic description of envisaged processing, assessment of necessity and proportionality, risk assessment, and measures to address risks
auditor_questions: Show me the DPIA for processing operations likely to result in high risk to rights and freedoms
How did you assess the necessity and proportionality of the processing in relation to its purpose?
What risks to the rights and freedoms of data subjects were identified?
What measures are envisaged to address those risks and demonstrate compliance?

maturity_levels.basic: DPIA conducted for high-risk processing with basic risk assessment
maturity_levels.intermediate: Systematic DPIA methodology, stakeholder consultation, risk mitigation measures tracked and validated
maturity_levels.advanced: Continuous DPIA reviews, automated risk scoring, integrated with processing activity register and security controls

description: Documentation of Data Protection Officer designation by the controller, including evidence of DPO qualifications, independence, resource allocation, and records of DPO activities such as monitoring compliance, providing advice on DPIAs, and cooperating with the supervisory authority
auditor_questions: Show me the formal designation of the Data Protection Officer and evidence of their qualifications
How do you ensure the DPO operates independently and is not subject to instructions regarding the exercise of their tasks?
What resources are allocated to the DPO to fulfil their monitoring and advisory duties?
Show me evidence of DPO involvement in data protection impact assessments and compliance monitoring

maturity_levels.basic: DPO formally designated with documented qualifications and contact details published
maturity_levels.intermediate: DPO independence assured, adequate resources allocated, regular compliance reporting, DPIA advisory role documented
maturity_levels.advanced: DPO embedded in governance structure, proactive compliance programme, direct reporting to highest management level, continuous training

requirement_summary: Right to erasure or restriction of processing
description: Documented procedures for handling data subject requests for erasure or restriction of processing of personal data in law enforcement contexts, including criteria for determining when erasure or restriction is appropriate and mechanisms for informing recipients of such actions
auditor_questions: Show me your procedures for handling erasure and restriction of processing requests
How do you determine whether personal data should be erased or restricted?
How do you inform recipients of personal data about erasure or restriction actions?
What safeguards are in place to ensure restriction effectively limits further processing?

maturity_levels.basic: Erasure and restriction procedures documented with basic criteria for determination
maturity_levels.intermediate: Structured request handling workflow, recipient notification process, restriction mechanisms enforced technically
maturity_levels.advanced: Automated erasure and restriction workflows, real-time recipient notification, audit trail for all actions taken

requirement_summary: Communication and modalities for exercising data subject rights
description: Documented modalities and procedures enabling data subjects to exercise their rights, including information provided to data subjects about their rights, means of communication, identity verification processes, and response timelines
auditor_questions: Show me how data subjects are informed of their rights and how to exercise them
What procedures exist for verifying the identity of data subjects making requests?
What is your response timeline for data subject requests and how do you track compliance?
Under what circumstances can you restrict or delay the provision of information to data subjects?

maturity_levels.basic: Rights information published, basic request handling procedures in place
maturity_levels.intermediate: Structured request management system, identity verification protocol, response timeline tracking, documented restriction criteria
maturity_levels.advanced: Digital self-service portal for data subject requests, automated identity verification, real-time compliance tracking, transparent restriction justification
